content: it s all about the messy bun by june nemeth you will need less than 100g of worsted weight yarn i used red heart boutique unforgettable in parrot size h hook & tapestry needle to sew in ends 1 note the ch2 at the beginning of each round does not count as a stitch the ch2 is to help hide your join line when you slip_stitch into the top of the chain at the end of each round to join pull snugly before crocheting into the first stitch this helps to close up the gap a bit notice the join line is hardly noticeable my color changes happen to occur at the exact point of the join for this hat creating a very noticeable jog line more than likely yours won t be as noticeable 2 chain 36 and join in the round to the first chain being careful not to twist this will give you an opening that is approximately 2 ½ in diameter row 1 ch2 double_crochet in first chain stitch and in each stitch around join with slip_stitch to ch2 36 stitches row 2 ch2 * 2 double_crochet in the first stitch double_crochet in next 2 stitches repeat from * around join with slip stitch to the ch2 48 stitches row 3 ch2 * 2 double_crochet in the first stitch double_crochet in next 3 stitches repeat from * around join with slip stitch to the ch2 60 stitches 3 row 4 ch2 * 2 double_crochet in the first stitch double_crochet in next 4 stitches repeat from * around join with a slip_stitch to the ch2 72 stitches row 5- 11** ch2 double_crochet in each stitch around join with a slip_stitch to the ch2 ** you can make it longer or shorter by adding or decreasing these double_crochet row take in to account that the ribbed brim will add approx 2 more inches to the hat ribbed brim when you have completed your last double_crochet row and joined to the ch2 ch11 stitches single_crochet into the 2nd chain from the hook and in each chain to the hat 10 stitches slip_stitch into the next 2 stitches on the hat the double_crochet stitches of the last double_crochet row worked in the round ch1 and turn now begin to crochet into the back loops only ** single_crochet into the blo of the next 10 stitches on the final stitch 10th stitch on the edge crochet into both loops for this row and throughout for a nicer finished edge ch1 and turn single_crochet into the blo of each of the 10 single_crochet stitches then slip_stitch into the next 2 stitches of the last double_crochet round ch1 and turn repeat from ** around the entire hat until you have only 1 stitch left on the hat to slip_stitch into if you have 2 that s ok as you are working the headband it will look like this 4 hold the 2 edges of the
